title: Tranquillity Prevailing Around Kovalam
text:
By Preeti R Mishra | Submitted On July 13, 2015 
A line everyone has heard, but not something everyone experiences. Visit Kovalam to know what the word 'bliss' truly means. Popularly known as the "Paradise of the South", the tranquillity of the area is sure to leave any human awed and craving for more. 
Bestowed with pristine beaches lined with picturesque coconut palms, Kovalam seems to be the perfect name for this South Indian city. Its literal meaning is "a grove of coconut trees". Kovalam offers an endless and pleasing sight of tall, slender, coconut trees. The crescent-shaped beach is cut-out to three parts. The southern beach, and for obvious reasons the most popular one, is the light house beach. It offers an amazing view of Vizhinjam mosque and is a beauty not worth missing. The northern beach, known as Samudra is a laidback, private sort of beach. The simplicity and atmosphere here makes it seem that the beach has not been touched by time since ages. The middle, or the hawah, is a beach buzzing with activities of fishermen setting out for sea in the early morning hours. With a high rock outcrop which is almost like a peninsula and a calm bay, this beach is no less than a paradise, creating unparalleled magic on moonlit nights. 
What to do in Kovalam 
1. The beaches: 
a. Kovalam Beach 
The Kovalam Beach is a beauty! Apart from the view the place also offers several beach activities such as swimming, sun-tanning, Ayurvedic treatments, catamaran cruising, etc. which are enough to drench one in the excitement 
b. Lighthouse Beach 
Almost all tourists want to visit Lighthouse Beach, which is not very far from the main city. The main attraction of Lighthouse Beach is the view from the top. Tourists can reach the top via a flight of stairs and gain the highly exciting scenic vistas of the flanking areas. The entire area is alluring, and a perfect backdrop for memorable snaps. 
c. Pozhikkara Beach 
The Pozhikkara Beach, Pachalloor is one of the most serene and picture-perfect beaches of South India. This is the place where the backwater meets the sea and is known for its spectacular coastline. The clear water and the golden sand topped with the azure sky, this place is a perfect destination to get sun kissed and show off the lovely tan. 
d. Hawa Beach 
The Hawa Beach is one of the three beaches that together form the crescent of the Kovalam Beach. Endearingly known as the Eve's Beach, It is a heaven for those who are looking for some much needed peace away from the humdrum of the city life. 
2. Artificial Off-Shore Coral Reef 
The artificial coral reef at Kovalam is India's first off-shore coral reef. Built with the aim of protecting the beach from erosions, this man made reef is a major crowd attraction owing to its beauty. It is now also a popular surfing resort. 
3. Vizhinjam Rock Cut Cave 
Important for both its historical and religious significance, the rock cut caves date back to the 18th century. Dedicated to Vinandhra Dakshinamurthy, the caves are famous for the beautiful sculptures, specially the unfinished sculpture of Shiva and Parvathy. The ancient caves, often paralleled to the Elephanta, are a major attraction especially for foreign tourists. 
4. Karamana river 
Known for its boat rides, the freshwaters of Karamana are a bliss. The river offers cruises, kayaking, canoe rides and house boats. Unconventional night rides in the river are one hell of an experience, allowing one to gaze at the azure sky as the night breeze carries off your worries to an unknown destination. 
5. Gramam Village Fair 
Spread over a period of 10 days, the Kerala village fair is one of its kinds. Artisans recreate an entire village based on the bygone days of rural Kerala and people can relive the legacy they have only heard of in folklores. A merger of history, tradition and art, the fair is a spectacle of unhindered joy and festivity! 
6. Surfing 
Kovalam is probably the only beach, or by far the best beach in India which offers surfing in its true beauty. The artificial reef and the waves, make the Kovalam beach a perfect site to hit the waves and bring out the adventure maniac in you. Several resorts and surf clubs have trained escorts to help the novices, while the professionals can rent surfs and board headlong onto the waves. 
7. Eateries and restaurants 
The Fusion, is one of the most unique restaurant in Kovalam with its enticing and interesting menu that is a perfect confluence of the best of east. Suprabhatam is another breakfast place which offers Kerala's delicacies in a rustic setting. The sea food lovers are in for a time of their lives, as every small or big restaurant of this town offer mouth-watering sea food. Stroll around and try the local vendors and street hawkers for indigenous delicacies. Get spoiled for the rich choice in sea food in Kovalam! 
8. Ayurveda experience 
Embrace Ayurveda and lose yourself in this entrancing experience custom made to lead you to a state of nostalgia. As the oils soothe every inch of your soul, feel all your worries being driven away with each stroke of the blissful massage. 
Life at Kovalam never stops. And neither does the list of things to do in Kovalam and ought to visit. The leisure options are varied and diverse and sure to leave one satisfied and relaxed to the core. Experience the beauty of that coppery tan from the tropical sun, the pristine beaches and palm fringed walks, all in the heavenly city of Kovalam. Seal it all with the enchanting sunset, and these mesmerizing memories shall never fade!
